title: Mouse button swapping in RDP sessions
author: TheShanMan
body_snippet:
<!-- Feature Request -->

Please add an option to swap mouse buttons in RDP sessions, ideally on a per-connection basis.

If the host system has swapped mouse buttons and the RDP systems don't, or vice-versa, you have to click the opposite button while in the RDP session. If mRemoteNG translated a left click into a right click and vice-versa, the problem would be solved. A global option would be better than nothing but an option in the connection settings would be ideal.

iterations.description: Niche RDP feature request with viable workarounds (WSL+Remmina, AHK scripts); requires deep RDP ActiveX/MSTSCLib changes for minimal user impact, and the community has already found acceptable solutions

Guys, I just came up with a brilliant idea: directly use Windows’ WSL GUI feature. In Windows WSL, simply run

`sudo apt install remmina -y`

Then you can launch Remmina from the Windows Start menu using its shortcut. As we all know, Remmina supports customizing mouse left/right buttons in RDP connections.

With system-level left/right mouse button swap enabled on both local Windows and remote Ubuntu, Remmina in Windows WSL works as expected in RDP sessions without enabling its own mouse swap op...
